body:
ELVEN: The Lost Tribe is the next NFT collection from [@theartofyasmeen](https://twitter.com/TheArtofYasmeen) and is set to drop via [Fair.xyz](https://fair.xyz/) in March 2023. This limited edition collection is only Yasmeen’s second generative art collection and her first since the original ELVEN collection launched in September 2021.

So let’s breakdown exactly what The Lost Tribe is all about by taking Simon Sinek’s Golden Circle approach and starting with the Why?

## 💜 Why launch ELVEN: The Lost Tribe?

As with all projects within the ELVEN ecosystem, the primary goal is to share Yasmeen’s art with a global audience. Our gifted young artist continues to evolve her style and we know that the ELVEN you’ll meet in The Lost Tribe will be the most incredible looking ELVEN yet. Shrewd holders recognise that Yasmeen is a generational talent with limitless potential and a bright future ahead of her in the world of art and design. Not many artists can boast multiple sold out NFT collections, live performances at international events & government institutions and even a magazine cover by the age of 14. Collecting and holding her art on-chain really does present a unique long-term opportunity.

![Yasmeen on the cover of WKND Magazine and live on the Lovin Dubai show (2022)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/\_5r0ghXz6zhsmFlzQsjaY.png?height=709&width=1833)

We also hope to bring new people into our authentic little community. ELVEN continues to offer a safe, welcoming home for those in web3 that are not interested in bad actors, people screaming “LFG” constantly and quick flips. We are more like a family. We don’t make big sweeping promises we can’t keep, we don’t buy influence or fake engagement and we look out for each other.

The Lost Tribe is also a way for us to reward our community of ELVEN holders as the active holders are able to register for free claims of this new collection.

To be transparent, our focus with The Lost Tribe is art and community not profit. With that in mind, 100% of the funds raised from the mint will be put back into the community via:

1. Replenishing the stock of ELVEN in the community vault (used for giveaways.)

2. Picking up NFTs to use for project spotlights/triple giveaways.

3. Rewarding holders via our weekly collectors challenges.

4. Investing in the development & deployment of a customised, token-gated Metaverse space within the [Spatial.io](http://Spatial.io) platform.

## 💜 What is The Lost Tribe?

ELVEN: The Lost Tribe collection will contain just 888 NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain. This is a completely new collection that will not recycle any traits from the original collection though the same base model is used for the characters to ensure consistency of size/scale.

![Two of the rarest skins in The Lost Tribe - Sunlight and Pandora.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2N7oK_T9mPJ2s-Ph41MWj.png?height=900&width=1600)

The collection will be composed from more than a hundred brand new traits within the same 10x trait categories as the original collection with two slight modifications:

* Backgrounds

* Back (replacing “Wings” to accommodate some non-wing traits)

* Skin

* Clothes

* Mouth

* Eyes

* Special (face traits)

* Hair

* Head (replacing “Horns” to accommodate some non-horn traits)

* Ears

*Note that Back, Special and Head are rare trait categories that do not appear on every character in the collection. Rarity percentages will be calculated closer to the drop.*

Yasmeen wants The Lost Tribe to have some uniformity – to feel like a tribe – and so she is using a specific colour palette for the traits and applying colour theory methodology to ensure that the traits combine effectively to make every single ELVEN in the Lost Tribe look incredible. To help achieve this goal we will be going through the collection one by one after generation and using the excellent “re-roll” function on Fair.xyz to remove any ELVEN which we feel have trait combinations that don’t work well together.

![The Lost Tribe uses colour theory to ensure that they all  have a beautiful aesthetic.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yvO3KJj8OSa_z-rn75Nyw.png?height=900&width=1600)

We are also proud to announce that The Lost Tribe features two different skin traits that showcase **vitiligo**  - the autoimmune disorder that causes patches of skin to lose pigment or colour. It was Yasmeen’s own idea to include these traits as she had recently seen models with vitiligo featuring on various fashion shows and wanted to showcase the condition beautifully in digital art form.

![Examples of the beautiful vitiligo skins found in The Lost Tribe.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Dzh2kzsCT-6EiRZbCKBKS.png?height=900&width=1600)

## 💜 How will The Lost Tribe launch be organised?

**Collection Size:** 888 NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain 
 **Minting Site:** Minting will take place on Fair.xyz
**Date:** March 2023 - exact date TBC

The mint will take place in **4** **phases**:

### 💜 PHASE 1 – VIP allowlist mint 

This phase is reserved for active members of the token-gated ELVEN community. Wallet submission is open now (link just below.) Members of this allowlist will be able to mint **2x Lost Tribe NFT for free** (just paying gas).

<https://heymint.xyz/elven-the-lost-tribe-vip-list?preview=1676969736449>

### 💜 PHASE 2 – Collab Partners allowlist mint

This phase is reserved for members of partner communities who won allowlist spots. Collab Partners will be able to mint **2x Lost Tribe NFT @ 0.005 ETH** each.

### 💜 PHASE 3 – Holders’ mint

All ELVEN holders will be able to mint **2x additional Lost Tribe NFT @ 0.005 ETH** Those that minted in phase 1 will be able to mint again during this phase.

### 💜 PHASE 4 – Public mint

During this public phase **any remaining supply will be available to mint @ 0.009 ETH** The limit per wallet in this phase is 10 tokens.

**There are a couple of additional points to note regarding The Lost Tribe mint:**

1. The public mint will only take place if supply remains available.

2. We are in no rush with the launch of this collection. The mint will remain open in perpetuity as long as supply remains.

3. Lost Tribe minters will be able to verify in the ELVEN Discord to access the token-gated community, giveaways, collectors challenges & events.

![Another early look at some test generations of ELVEN: The Lost Tribe.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bgBJ_nKNuhbYmlgCP1GwG.jpg?height=900&width=1600)

We look forward to sharing more information about The Lost Tribe mint in the next couple of weeks. Holders – watch for regular announcements in the ELVEN Discord Non-holders - follow [@ELVEN_NFT](https://twitter.com/ELVEN_NFT) and turn notifications on to make sure you don’t miss out.

You can also subscribe to us here on Mirror to stay up to date on al things ELVEN.

<subscribe://>

Want to learn all about the original ELVEN project as well as Yasmeen’s work with VR art and her other NFT projects? Then make sure you read our previous article, **ELVEN: The Story So Far -**

<https://mirror.xyz/0x0414d789715a989FA8a6Bf0bD76FE78e1d2C83B0/MRj9pS3-prlGuF2-f-ooQzrxcXlziMj6YCFSerqG-Gk>

PS you can collect this article on Optimism for 0.001 ETH if you wish. Collecting the Mirror articles may lead to something in the future…

body:
Announcement: MantaSwap's New Zealy Channel!

We are incredibly excited to announce MantaSwap's official Zealy channel! This will be the place where we provide updates on our latest campaigns.

Follow us at <https://zealy.io/c/mantaswap> to stay informed about important news and engage with the MantaSwap community.

body:
Hi everyone , my name is vincent from gameland team. Let me introduce gameland for you.

First i want to introduce is our gameland user footprint. As you can see, there 3 button on this page.

When player logs in our platform, he need to register a game id. Game ID is the unified universal login authentication ID for players in the game ecosystem.

Game id function still developing ,we can’t present it by this time , if you are interesting in it , you can get more information in our deck .

now, there is a lack of an efficient and convenient distribution blog platform.

Gameland platform will integrate with different content platform such as Mirror, Lens and etc. User can share their posts with whole players on our platform.

user also can write their game experience , review and blogs on our platform. If you like their content, you can click the like button , make some comments and drop a reward for them.

body:
Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin is a stable and influential leader of the Russian Federation. He was elected President in 2000 and held this position until 2008. Then, after going through a difficult period of economic and political crisis, he returned to the presidency in 2012 and was re-elected in 2018. 
  
 Putin is pursuing an active domestic and foreign policy, striving to strengthen Russia as a country with a strong state power and a strong economy. He actively participates in international interactions, especially with states with which Russia traditionally maintains friendly relations. 
  
 A diverse and comprehensive view of the modern world and its problems is one of the main features of Putin and his leadership of Russia. He is actively working on the prospects for the development of the country's economy and infrastructure, strengthening an integrated approach to social problems and ensuring a productive dialogue with various levels of society. 
  
 Putin is also distinguished by his ability to take decisive action in difficult situations and find the best ways to achieve goals. He called for taking a more active part in the fight against terrorism and ensuring a high level of security inside and outside the country. 
  
 It is believed that Putin is an exceptionally powerful and artistically charismatic political figure. He is confident, proud of his country and strives to do everything to support its power and glory around the world.

body:
![Photo credit: Midjourney](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RSTDElRW0GPJO-dCc3YIh.png?height=1024&width=1024)

## When it comes to taxing your regulars, context is everything.

Recently I took on a new project with an open source developer community that’s exploring ways to commercialize their technology with additional services or product layers for the first time.

In helping this technical team think through things like “utility taxes” or other service agreements, I’ve been thinking a lot about the hidden taxes that we pay without thinking, just to go about our day. Take credit card charges as one example.

I’ve been getting up and out the door for work much earlier than usual for the past few weeks, which means my normal coffee shops are closed. During normal business hours, I’m a regular at cafes that charge $4.50 for a drip coffee and $5.75 or more for a latte. But the only place to get a caffeine fix before 7am in NYC is at a coffee cart or a bodega, so I’ve had to change my routine.

I’ve been stopping at the same corner store for the past couple of weeks. The transaction is seamless: I walk in, pour myself a hazelnut drip coffee, add a sleeve, turn around, greet the shop owner, and tap my phone to pay. I’m in and out in 60 seconds. (They really know their audience.)

But yesterday I got a slightly later start to my day. Rather than walk in at 6:15, I walked in at 6:55 am, just minutes before the regular cafes start to open. Immediately I noticed the store was four times as crowded. There’s a line at the counter for breakfast sandwiches. I hesitate but repeat my routine: Pour myself a drip coffee, add a sleeve, turn around, greet the shop owner – but then pause. There’s now a woman at the register. That’s new.

I offer her my phone but she shakes her head. I remove my headphones fully to listen:

She’s saying: *“Credit card minimum. Cash only. That’ll be $2.75.”*

I immediately felt a wave of indignation pass over me. But fortunately I happened to have exactly $3 in cash in my pocket so I decided not to debate her on my conflicting actions from the past few weeks. I complete the exchange, take the quarter as change and move along. Annoyed and a little confused, but mostly just happy to have caffeine in hand.

Today however, I’m back to my usual schedule. When I clock into the bodega at 6:23 am, the usual crowd of construction workers and truck drivers are all in place as usual. I walk in, pour a drip coffee, add a sleeve, greet the shop owner, and eye him carefully as I reach out my phone to pay.

He says: *“ApplePay? That’ll be $3.”*

Aha! I immediately break into a smile. That explains it. All along I’ve been paying a 9% increase in coffee cost for the privilege of using my credit card.

It made me wonder: Why was I so annoyed yesterday by the woman who charged me 25 cents *less* for the coffee, and not annoyed by the man who’d been covertly upcharging me 25 cents a day for the past three weeks?

Obviously in this particular instance, it was less about the price I was paying and more for the convenience of sticking to my workflow. Like it or not, when I walk in, headphones around my head, with the look of a hurried and focused workaholic, this guy knew he’d be better off letting me stick to my flow state of doing things my way. And frankly – and this is the kicker – I *still* feel like I’m getting a deal.

Given the significantly lower cost of a bodega coffee compared to my usual places, the 25-cent difference barely even caught my attention. Even a $3 coffee is $1.50 less than I pay at 7am.

If there’s a conclusion to be drawn from this reductionist example, maybe it’s this: Whether you’re selling coffee at 6am in NYC or selling infrastructure for software developers and builders, context is everything.

How can you identify the people who won’t mind (or maybe even notice) a marginal cost increase to guarantee ongoing minimal disruption? Who are those people (or communities)? And how much would they pay to sustain their version of “flow state”? I’d love to hear more about open source projects who are tapping into this user exploration effectively.

body: I wanted to be in the FBI. I also wanted to be a pie salesman. It was so intense that the studio got the prop department to make a little pie wagon and they filled it with tarts. I wheeled it around the set and sold them to the crew. I was about 8 years old. I always sold out and I didn't have to pay for them. It was a great deal!

body:
**Intro**

The first two sections are about defining loosely what sort of governance system exists in blockchains, and the second sections are about Ethereum’s upgrade to PoS. (Feel free to skip ahead).

Here’s a summary of each section, however.

* The Tripartite System.

* How the blocksize wars illustrated the tripartite in action.

* Discuss the Merge and the new actors that have emerged.

* Conclude and discuss the inevitability of this.

**Evolving In Place**

It’s been more than 10 years since Satoshi Nakamoto wrote the original Bitcoin white-paper. During the past decade or so, the market has molded the narrative in various functions and purposes; bitcoin has evolved from and intersected with payments, censorship resistant e-gold, reserve currency, inflation hedge, etc. And while this has certainly been a unique phenomena, I find the broader market has over-indexed on the narratives. Instead, they’ve failed to recognize the significance of the political theory that is so deeply embedded in the Bitcoin protocol, and moreover, the extraordinary ability to game-theoretically align various parties to cooperate in the system itself.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Ff0ea3903-a77f-4ac1-b0ea-aec0d3efe295_786x418.png)

Source: Nic Carter, **Visions of Bitcoin, 2018**

It is likely that Satoshi was greatly influenced by the US. This is because in both models, the US and Bitcoin, there are three \*\*separate \*\*powers that take complete ownership over a specific function. More importantly, however, while there is congruence, they still must ultimately check-and-balance each other during edge-cases so one function cannot reign supreme. In Bitcoin, the actors are functionally split into miners, developers, and nodes, and in the US, they are defined by the executive, legal, and judiciary branches. This sort of system is more formally known as the **TriPartite**.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F8dc2acb8-7f85-48eb-8d0f-3e8ee0e107e0_720x540.png)

Source: Ryan Gentry, **A Theory of Bitcoin Governance**

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F158d0403-1b51-44cb-bdfa-7b67b57d849f_800x470.png)

Ultimately, it is worth asking whether political theory holds up in the practical world? Lobbyism, super-pacs, gerry-mandering, term-years, media, external actors, etc. are some of the leading stressors of the US tripartite. And this is not to say it has failed. Rather, it is to recognize what are the outcomes when institutional theory diverges and to ask if the system still is largely true to its nature, does it still have **integrity**?

**Governance Trial** 

In retrospect, the core innovation of the Bitcoin protocol remains as a \*\*trial-run for the open-source tripartite. \**This was best illustrated in 2015 when a seemingly innocuous technical feature became lighter-fluid for a colossal governance stress-test. This epoch in crypto-history become known as the BlockSize Wars*. \*\*\*

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F2ced8dcf-47f8-4a87-9cbb-1846fc0ce5d0_595x332.png)

What’s important to recognize is how the system was working as designed, that the various branches of Bitcoin’s governance system were clashing and seeking consensus with each other. For instance, a number of prominent miners sought to increase the block-size limit almost unilaterally , but were effectively vetoed when core-developers did not merge the necessary code changes and economic nodes refused to propagate and validate their forked transactions. Some users / economic nodes purposely exerted negative price pressure through market actions. There were many other subtle and macro actions throughout the blocksize wars that illustrated what were soft-and-hard limitations of control that miners, nodes, and developers possessed. And this is what precisely would make Bitcoin more resilient, more antifragile as Taleb would argue; the market would realize there is a system fighting for the soul of Bitcoin instead of a centralizing actor

> *Some things benefit from shocks; they thrive and grow when exposed to volatility, randomness, disorder, and stressors and love adventure , risk, and uncertainty. Yet, in spite of the ubiquity of the phenomenon, there is no word for the exact opposite of fragile. Let us call it antifragile. Antifragility is beyond resilience or robustness. The resilient resists shocks and stays the same; the antifragile gets better.*

However, where Bitcoin has succeeded has been in its sheer simplicity, which manifested in the communities unwillingness to make major changes to the  protocol’s crypto-economic policies and reliance on technically-complex layer-2 solutions such as Lightning, other base-layer blockchains with smart-contract functionality emerged in place of them.

Enter Ethereum.

**The Merge So Boring**

A few weeks prior to Ethereum’s long awaited upgrade to PoS from Pow, known as the ***Merge***, glimmers of contention started to emerge.

* @GaloisCapital then polled the Ethereum community and ran them through a list of scenarios. It was (and still is) worth checking out the thread.

  <https://twitter.com/Galois_Capital/status/1552387715362070528?s=20&t=Z_G5O0IeZglwyB13D-VUNg>

  <https://twitter.com/Galois_Capital/status/1552387721825492994?s=20&t=Z_G5O0IeZglwyB13D-VUNg>



* Miners and their related entities, made noise about the values of PoW. Given their large capital intensive operations and their loss of future operations, it's more than likely miners are motivated by financial exigency.

  <https://twitter.com/EthereumPoW/status/1557273067725787137?s=20&t=GZJili8-xAXKjgKyUbNrpA>


However, the merge was\*\* flawlessly executed and totally uneventful\*\*. Even in terms of price action, ETHW could barely mount meaningful market-share, and instead, ETH Classic continued to outperform other alt-coins. Of course, Ethereum PoS had earned a lot of social capital over the years, since PoS has been on its roadmap for some time. And yet, there is something worth examining here beyond the pros-and-cons of PoS vs. PoW.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F53f780bb-feef-469b-9e02-dc05d31b5962_1436x852.png)

**Top-Heavy**

In the legacy world of Bitcoin, it was miners, economic nodes, and developers who jostled for control at level playing field. However, it’s undeniable that Ethereum had undergone a quiet sort of revolution over the years, its power-structure becoming increasingly \*\*top-heavy. \*\*This is to say, modern structures were able to encroach upon the tripartite system inherited from Bitcoin’s design, and had tremendous influence on the path-dependency of Ethereum’s future.

Let’s examine.

Stablecoin issuers, such as Circle ($USDC) and Tether ($TUSD), exert the most control on the system. Collectively, these fiat infrastructure service providers account for approximately $100 billion in market capitalization, or approximately 10% of the total crypto-market-capitalization.  So what exactly happened? First, Circle had pledged “sole” support of PoS Ethereum.

![Source: Circle](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F03b4e396-335f-4575-93be-005b104d0879_730x208.png)

And second, while there was speculation that Paolo Ardoino of Tether was more in support of the PoW world, Ardino made the business decision to not cause instability in the already battered crypto market. What if there was broad end-user consensus to use PoW but Circle had chosen to solely support PoS? I believe given how much stablecoin infrastructure and stablecoin denominated leverage built into the DeFi system (i.e MakerDao, Aave, etc.), users would have no choice to side with Circle. And this is why Tether had to roll with Circle and PoS – its package deal.

> 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AnwF1D5bOUP5F1MAWkJwc.png?height=328&width=608)

Followed by Stablecoin Issuers, I believe centralized exchanges are the next modern power structure in the stack. And while exchanges were a force in the Bitcoin wars, I believe they have grown in influence. Simply said, they determine where end-users can on-ramp and off-ramp their crypto, distributing any prospective airdrops, and can forcefully choose to not make markets on their platform hence destroying liquidity and destroying any forks.

Next, without ChainLink, the largest provider of Oracle services, one cannot reasonably advance the state because a number of applications depend on off-chain data. Moreover, much of the value proposition of ChainLink resides in its network effects which further increases reliance on a **single** oracle service. This is because users who need the same information feed can cost-share the same oracle all while increasing the networks security budget (manifested in price of $LINK) in the form of fees. While there are other oracle providers, Chainlink has dominated the market for these reasons. And so, let us ask again, if ChainLink does not support PoW, would the application space survive? Yes, but it would not be without difficulty.

![Source: ChainLink](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F7a01aa60-0011-4859-999e-341cd6c7da08_845x111.png)

And lastly, while not exactly related, and certainly embedded in the Ethereum code-base since 2016, the difficulty bomb had simply nuked any % chance that ETH PoW would survive. The chain rapidly became unusable, which is why Ethereum Classic’s hash-rate and price action rocketed up.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fb5ff4c3a-ae66-4355-afd7-19def7fae4d8_1356x668.png)

With the combination of the above modern structures and difficulty bomb, it is no wonder why Ethereum merge was incredibly uneventful.

**Conclusion**

The more salient question, was this always inevitable? I believe so. Mature smart-contract blockchains cannot exist without large modern structures, i.e stablecoins, oracles, exchanges, wallets, market-places, etc. All of these entities will compete for users and consensus – power.  And surely, this will erode the tripartite. The opposite of this however is Bitcoin, a closed, non-complex layer that has struggled to attract innovation and has confused the broader world with its multiple narratives. To me, Bitcoin remains a paper-perfect political innovation, a theoretical giant whereas Ethereum is where governance and pragmatism converge, where theory and reality meet.

Nevertheless, all blockchains will need to contend with these issues if they wish to find broad-based adoption.

Sources:

**[https://ryanthegentry.medium.com/a-theory-of-bitcoin-governance-](https://ryanthegentry.medium.com/a-theory-of-bitcoin-governance-13510eff42a6)**

**https://medium.com/@nic__carter/visions-of-bitcoin-4b7b7cbcd24c[13510eff42a6](https://ryanthegentry.medium.com/a-theory-of-bitcoin-governance-13510eff42a6)**

*A podcast where artists, musicians and web3 builders talk about the future. Hosted by [Nick Hollins](https://twitter.com/nick_hollins) and produced by Apollo.*

<https://player.simplecast.com/77d7e389-da33-4124-9e5a-4dd9cf221141?display=iframe&height=200px>

### Subscribe

[iTunes](https://podcasts.apple.com/au/podcast/ufo/id1647366883) • [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/show/13C5u5EiUXwlFsJUKYvEN5) • [Everywhere](https://linktr.ee/ufo__club) • [Lens](https://lenster.xyz/u/ufoclub.lens) • [RSS](https://feeds.simplecast.com/nJtMnS73)

Yuri Rybak is a musician and producer. Partnerships at ZORA. Member at Friends With Benefits, including as a producer at NFT Pirate Radio with Chuck Anderson.

In this episode we talk about writing and producing music, the music industry, and what we see as emergent for music NFTs and artist collectives.

We get into Yuri’s musical path through life, leading to early involvement with FWB, where he was on the scene for many experiments in NFT releases from artists including Glassface, Pussy Riot, and Eric Hu.

Experiences from the inside at ZORA where he now works, what’s up over there, their brand and creative, zorbs, minting to 1155 contracts, and the rising ecosystem of Nouns Builder projects.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c7QToH-iBClT8G-wWmcJ-.jpg?height=2750&width=2200&size=large)

body:
There's something about arcade games that just hits differently. Those were the days when games were all about the fun, no need to have dazzling graphics or complex storylines.  That’s why stumbling upon BIGA felt like finding a secret portal back to those carefree days. It's like this cool blend of old-school arcade vibes with 6 different games to dive into. But let’s see if BIGA's got the magic to make us fall in love with arcade games all over again.

**GAMEPLAY SUMMARY**

BIGA Arcade reinvents the traditional gaming experience by merging the excitement of arcade games with the opportunity to earn real money. This innovative platform features a wide selection of browser-based games tailored to suit various tastes and skill levels, turning gaming prowess into potential income. Players can achieve and maintain high scores on individual game levels to gain "ownership," which comes with financial benefits. As others attempt to beat these high scores, a portion of their fees is allocated to the level's owner, allowing for continuous earnings as long as they hold the top spot. For games that do not focus on level ownership, BIGA utilizes a leaderboard system where players compete to rank among the top 100, with their positions determining their earnings. The higher a player ranks, the greater their payout, creating a competitive environment that motivates players to continuously improve their skills. This innovative approach not only keeps players engaged but also offers a tangible reward for their gaming achievements, blending entertainment with the lure of financial gains.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jSXao267X1dohMtbc55U3.jpg?height=383&width=680)

**OVERALL IMPRESSION**

**Accessibility & Interface**

Jumping into BIGA is like walking into your favorite arcade spot, except it's right there on your browser. No downloads, no fancy PC required. Just pure, unadulterated game-hopping fun. It's so easy to get started on playing. But what I've noticed is that – not all games in BIGA have tutorials in the beginning. Some will have you confused, losing credits, and wondering how to even play it. Some games like Jetpack Galaxy-Rush do a good job with a quick tutorial, but I think a universal "How-to-Play'' across the board wouldn't hurt.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bwTitQENxa4OSX6QYAoWM.jpg?height=386&width=686)

**Gameplay Experience**

The games on BIGA might look simple at first glance – but they can suck you in. What's even cooler is that you're not just playing to beat your own boredom; you're in it to win it – literally. Scoring high or smashing that leaderboard not only boosts your ego but your wallet too. The games are simple but mastering them? That's where the real challenge lies. Plus, there's this odd satisfaction in knowing that a game as straightforward as "Watermelon Game" can have you strategizing. One thing I noticed is that the frequent analytics pop-ups can be a minor distraction. It’s a small grip but when you're hopping from game to game, it adds up.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/v_DmFSCbtZZ5cV-EsNfta.png?height=788&width=1400)

**Technical Performance**

The platform excels in technical performance, with games loading almost instantaneously and running smoothly on my device. This quick, efficient access further enhances BIGA's appeal. The fluidity of gameplay and the absence of technical hitches speak volumes about BIGA's optimization for browser play.

Overall, BIGA is a fusion of classic arcade fun and modern competitive gaming. It's got its little quirks, but the blend of easy access, addictive gameplay, and the thrill of earning is a winning combo. It's refreshing, it's engaging, and it might just be the future of online gaming for those who love the classics but are ready to kick it up a notch. So, if you're game for a challenge and fancy earning along the way, BIGA's waiting for you to press play.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fvmOWjFzK0YZvOCITq9xk.JPG?height=720&width=1277)

body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lLhwTv82bzMIqOkFB3xNP.png?height=1231&width=3369)

**<https://www.eigenlayer.com/EigenLayer>**

** 
 **

## Restake it to Make it

EigenLayer is a fascinating play. It's not another layer 2 for Ethereum, it's a blockchain, based on Ethereum that looks to productionise the Ethereum validator network. That means it will allow Ethereum validators to use their staking contracts to also provide security to other dapps, which will live on the EigenLayer. Practically speaking this means someone participating in staking on Ethereum will be able to restake that $ETH  into an EigenLayer contract in order to provide security to another application and they'll get additional yield for doing so (on top of the yield staking $ETH  gives them). With staking yields on Ethereum set to fall as more validators join the network you’ll see more and more stakers looking for ways to increase their overall yield.

This isn't too dissimilar in mechanics to how liquid staking contracts on Ethereum allow you to use your staked $ETH  tokens in other defi dapps (in order to increase your yield) as well as still retaining the validator role and the staking rewards they represent. In broader sense though it's actually very different as what the restaking to the EigenLayer means is essentially you're copy pasting the same staking contract (which includes slashing, EigenLayer contracts will have the same slashing ability as Ethereum validator contracts do now) to another separate process in order to grant it the same security guarantees that your staked $ETH  on Ethereum gives the Ethereum.** 
 **

An even wilder future sees the validator network operate as a separate entity to Ethereum, where Ethereum itself is but one dapp that is accessing the power of that network. EigenLayer, in that sense, is trying to turn the Ethereum validator network into an on demand cloud security service. 

** 
 **

I think it's an ambitious goal but it’s got a solid core thesis. It's widely acknowledged that the killer app of Ethereum is its massive validator network. It's what has allowed Layer 2 chains to thrive as they've been able to leverage that network to instantly build their security and to immediately access the existing Ethereum ecosystem.

 
 There is another, more complex argument, that EigenLayer increases Ethereum security in a way that current dapps (both protocols like Chainlink & Curve and Layer 2s like Arbitrum) don’t.

You'll have to listen to the Empire podcast episode below to hear Sreeram Kannan and Calvin Liu explain it in full as I don't fully understand it myself. It revolves around the concept of the weakest point of attack and the fundamental difference in EigenLayer's relationship to the Ethereum network as opposed to other dapps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/K9YFXA3YmpVUraumEuX-i.png?height=427&width=2235)

 
 <https://open.spotify.com/episode/2BgS6wMrQS1Ns0YPoBitbV?si=kyU3_ngGTbKkoIpNDcxw0w&utm_source=copy-link>

** 
  
 **

## Details details details

Luckily Sreeram Kannan’s interview with the Blockworks Research podcast makes it a lot clearer. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S-71bZqVSBwlOpx-dUtg8.png?height=440&width=2194)

<https://open.spotify.com/episode/2vXhHiH7JRMgnOxdJabNi1?si=jA2QoqrhR3KkczlBhyAC9A>

** 
 **

Sreeram is envisaging creating a market for levels of decentralisation so that solo stakers are able to compete with large stakers. That's important, if possible. As any blockchain is always under the threat of centralisation and capture by a single entity.

Now all that is great but there are caveats. 

The biggest caveat for me is around how slashing will work. 

Slashing someone's staked $ETH  is a serious business. It can result in thousands to millions of dollars of collateral being wiped out. Thus the Ethereum validator contracts have very strict and clear rules around how that process happens. 

EigenLayer enables any dapp to inherit that slashing ability but across many different use cases. 

For example if you were securing an insurance contract you might instigate a rule where if counterparties didn't authorise a contract, within a certain period of time, you'd slash the staked $ETH  which had been used to secure that contract. 

Another example, from the Blockworks Research podcast, was if you were running a storage network you might require storage providers to routinely send you a proof of storage and if they didn't comply within a certain timeframe you would slash the staked $ETH  which was committed to ensuring that security.

Given the complexity here and the fact there is little chance any of these use cases will be able to be fine tuned the way the single Ethereum validation use case has been, EigenLayer uses a two step process in order to allow slashing to occur. 

The first step is via the smart contract that has been implemented for the staked $ETH  to be restaked under. 

The second step is the most controversial; and the one which I think EigenLayer may eventually fail at. The slashing request is sent to a committee which will ultimately decide whether to allow it. This is a X number person committee that will be elected by the protocol layer as a whole through a DAO structure (yet to be set up). Sreeram didn't say what that number would be but the figure of 10-12 was thrown out by the podcast hosts and wasn't pushed back on…

 
 I find it incredulous that an entire decentralised network of 'verify don't trust' smart contracts would narrow to one tiny choke point of a centralised, human committee, that would then be expected to make complex technical judgements across a possibly very wide range of different applications.

Also the insurance bond mechanism design, another safety measure, doesn't seem to be at all developed, despite being a seemingly key aspect of reducing risk for people staking significant sums of money.

** 
 **

It all seems very theoretical and the claimed benefits and features seem incredibly optimistic. Whilst Layer 2s like Optimism or Arbitrim, or a Layer 1 like Avalanche, may be successful working blockchains, the lived experience of them is often far from the stated optimal experience. They’re good, they’re just not great yet. 

This to me sums up a lot of the blockchain space at times. The tech is powerful, not just just technically but socially, and it gives rise to so many possibilities, but the details matter. It's what killed blockchain for the supply chain, insurance, etc.. projects. The general concepts were solid but when you got to the details they fell apart.

For example: Bitcoin, the longest running successful blockchain, couldn't make its original core thesis work: It has failed as a payments network. But it has succeeded as a digital asset and alternate store of value. That's been down to the technical details. Bitcoin is too slow, too expensive, and too rigid. But all those things made a really good digital asset as it retained and increased value over time and has proved incredibly secure.

** 
  
 **

## Enter Vitalik

I’ve had this post in a draft for a couple of months (everything above) but just hadn’t found the time to post. 

I’m glad I didn’t because just recently Vitalik Butlerin dropped a neutron bomb into the restaking debate with his blog post warning against the risks to the core Ethereum security model.

*Key to note Vitalik doesn’t speak for Ethereum perse. He’s not the CEO. He holds a lot of influence but Ethereum is a consensus governance model at the end of the day.*

** 
 **

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dQfyPJbcMdumf8_AQYwXl.png?height=1044&width=1716)

<https://vitalik.ca/general/2023/05/21/dont_overload.html> 

** 
  
 **

Vitalik makes some interesting points about the ways in which expanding the functions of the Layer 1 security mechanism to enable that security to be exported to other applications is a very dangerous thing if not kept to a very narrow set of design.** 
 **

Vitalik is largely ambivalent towards something like EigenLayer as long as the restaking mechanism doesn’t end up relying on the Ethereum mainnet as its ultimate fall-back security. And what I mean by that is, if EigenLayer ultimately relies on the Ethereum mainnet conducting a hard fork to rescue stolen funds (or resolve a community division) then that threatens the core consensus of the Ethereum chain, and if that consensus is compromised enough then Ethereum will lose all its' value as participants will no longer have any trust in it. All this from one protocol that was leveraging Ethereum security.** 
 **

Vitalik argues that restaking can be low risk but that there is a slippery slope here that can quickly lead to high risk. This example from the blog post lays this out clearly:

* Dogecoin decides to switch to proof of stake, and to increase the size of its security pool it allows Ethereum stakers to "dual-stake" and simultaneously join its validator set. To do so, Ethereum stakers would have to change their staking withdrawal address to a smart contract where anyone can submit a proof that they violated the Dogecoin staking rules. If someone does submit such a proof, then the staker's validator is forcibly exited, and whatever of their $ETH is left is used to buy-and-burn DOGE. Low-risk.

* eCash does the same as Dogecoin, but the project leaders further announce: if the majority of participating $ETH validators collude to censor eCash transactions, they expect that the Ethereum community will hard-fork to delete those validators. They argue that it will be in Ethereum's interest to do so as those validators are proven to be malicious and unreliable. High-risk.

‌

The blog post is deeply detailed so I’d encourage you to dig into it to better understand the conceptual and technical considerations here. It’s written in a way that even non technical people will be able to follow the concepts and scenarios he lays out.

** 
 **

Something to consider while reading through it is: When do the Layer 2 projects become a real and present danger to the security of Ethereum?

It’s not covered in the post itself and I feel like that’s because Ethereum are staking so much on the Layer 2 solutions helping fix the accessibility issues (super high transaction fees) Ethereum has that they don’t really want to delve into the risks right at this moment.  
  
 However I think there are risks here that should be talked about.  

At present we only really have optimistic rollup Layer 2s so any attack on them is likely to be identified before the rolled up transaction blocks are finalised on Ethereum as this process takes 7 days. It’s really hard to hide significant malicious activity, for 7 days, on an open ledger.

However that doesn’t mean it can’t happen and with the advent now of zk rollups we have a Layer 2 solution which resolves to Ethereum in much shorter time windows thus opening the door to large scale attacks that are able to corrupt the zero knowledge proofs and get their changes committed to the Ethereum mainnet.

Ethereum validators don’t know what is happening on Layer 2 at the transaction level. All they can see is the transaction summary that’s submitted to Ethereum in order to be included in the next available block and whatever fraud proof is generated. Should you see the fraud proofs corrupted (whatever security you can think of has been able to be compromised, often in ways you never could’ve predicted), then you’ve got fraudulent transactions now on Ethereum mainnet. 

Should any of these Layer 2s start to hold larger TVL than Ethereum herself (and on current trends that is a likely possibility) then there becomes a huge incentive to hard fork Ethereum in order to protect a very large chunk of all the capital in the broader Ethereum ecosystem.

** 
 **

## ‌Sreeram responds

The first half of the weekly round up from the The Defiant team is an interview with Sreeram Kannan talking about the Vitalik article about the risk to the Ethereum protocol posed by applications who look to expand the validator set uses, like EigenLayer does for restaking. ** 
 **

### Ethereum's "Systemic Risk", PulseChain, Solana AI, Multichain issue, Tornado Cash

### https://www.youtube.com/live/rthlIUzTBuM?feature=share

** 
  
 **

Sreeram does what he’s done in a number of interviews I’ve watched and avoids many of the more pointed questions raised both by the Defiant team and particularly the Vitalik article.

In fairness he addresses the main issue, the slippery slope problem, by saying EigenLayer won’t let that happen. When Sreeram is pushed to explain how EigenLayer is going to protect against that he doesn’t really have an answer. The best answer he gives is the veto council (the one which is a dozen or so humans) will protect against it. But even then he goes onto explain he expects the veto council to be temporary as apps on EigenLayer will transition to permissionless slashing after a period of time and he never discusses how EigenLayer will handle the issues of that slippery slope Vitalik warned against, if a dapp is heading down that path, but it’s not under the control of the veto council.

** 
 **

### Ethereum the nation state

Camila Russo, the founder of Defiant, had the best takeaway from the Vitalik article (and I’m paraphrasing):

*Ethereum has become a de facto government for a bunch of other protocols. Vitalik is essentially saying Ethereum will not be conducting bailouts for actors in the ecosystem in the advent of non-core Ethereum validation issues. That is, an app/protocol has seen transactions committed to its own consensus which have then been validated correctly on Ethereum herself (remembering Ethereum consensus only is concerned with the transactions directly on the Layer 1).*

** 
 **

It’s a very interesting take on the Ethereum stance as I expect a large number of players within the Ethereum ecosystem (implicitly or explicitly) assume the Ethereum will act to support the ecosystem outside of permission-less security via its social consensus. 

I very much expect the biggest players are banking on this as a guarantee.** 
 **

And Ethereum has hard forked before to protect a large dapp. That’s why we have Ethereum Classic (which, to his credit, Vitalik mentions explicitly in his post).

** 
 **Interesting times ahead.

body:
We’re happy to announce that we’ve been accepted into the Aleph Zero Ecosystem Funding Program (EFP) and will be receiving support to move forward the development of Explora Online game.

Explora Online is an 2D MMORPG game set in the Age of Exploration where wooden ships rule the seas, and old worlds meet new horizons. Players will be immersed in a fantasy world named Zerth, where they can set sail across the high seas and traverse new lands in search of gold, rare artifacts, and new cultures!

Every player begins with a Ship and is sent on a Quest to begin their navigation career.

Trade discoveries on the Aleph Zero NFT marketplace, acquire gold within the game to upgrade your ship and advance in rank.

Explora Online is being developed using Playfab and Godot Engine 4.0, an open-source game engine that simplifies the creation of 2D and 3D games. We’ll be sharing our progress here in our blog, as well through our social channels on Twitter and Discord.

We’ve been actively working on the foundational elements of Explora, those include the Account Manager, where you’ll be able to manage all your assets associated with your account, as well as transfer in-game assets and convert them into NFTs. We are also working on an NFT marketplace specifically for Explora items.

In-Game assets are categorized into four groups: Avatars, Ships, Items, and Discoveries. We’ve made this possible so you can easily trade your assets without selling your full account.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HOnHBkzGTo5NbcPmISe58.png?height=714&width=1430)

**Avatars** are the in-game characters you control, these particular assets carry the game history and knowledge that player gathers while using this character. As well, all the in-game currencies associated with the character are attached with this avatar. Ranks, levels, and allegiance are also associated with the avatars.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eUZJDC4fdjuAPxPGNHon0.png?height=690&width=1398)

**Ships** are the vessels used to navigate around the globe. These ships can also be leveled up, have health, and power-ups that provide different boosts for exploration and battle.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mqU3qeF3adk4ZRtN6Ann5.png?height=690&width=1400)

**Items** can be collected through your explorations, quests, or within shops within port cities where you sail to. These items can be used as power-ups for your ship or for temporary boosts for your avatar. They are ranked in rarity: common, rare, epic, and mythical.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lkQql30p8vYbmlyJVRDho.png?height=694&width=1404)

And finally, **Discoveries,** these assets play an important role in Explora as they are unique items discovered around the globe, as you traverse through uncharted territories. These collectibles are hidden and glittered across the map in distinct locations waiting to be found! Some discoveries come with power-ups, and some are simply 1 of 1s that hold value to the kingdoms and can be traded for gold in-game, or if you so choose, can be sold as NFTs to other players.

### Our Progress To Date

We’ve finished a preliminary version of the Account Manager so far, and we are headed into creating an alpha version of the game that will allow us to test the constraints of the map, the physics of the ship movement, and the port city features such as ship upgrades and mini-games.

We’ve made some elements publics on our repo to allow you to begin building a similar account manager as ours, that can be found here:

<https://github.com/explorao>

Our plans are to continue to contribute to the Aleph Zero Ecosystem by making it easier to onboard Web2 players, as well as create a game environment that excites other game developers to see that Aleph Zero is the perfect place to bring their game.

We believe the technology is there to make Web3 gaming a thriving use case within the ecosystem and we will pioneer the way on Aleph Zero to make sure the progress is made to open doors for gamers and game devs everywhere!

body:
## **Storm Trade - DEX for Everyone 🤝**

**Storm Trade** is a decentralized leveraged trading market based on dynamic AMM and allows you to trade all possible assets - cryptocurrencies, NFT, commodities (oil, gas and even wheat). Anything with a price can be added for trading on Storm!

Thanks to the advanced concept of **virtual** **dynamic AMM** (Automatic Market Maker), Storm does not need to own any real assets, which opens limitless possibilities in the trading world. It is enough for an asset to have a market price and liquidity, so that this price changes over time. It is this simple chain **"price - transmitter (oracle) - user "** that lies at the heart of Storm protocol. Having such a tool in the TON ecosystem will be potentially useful for risk allocation, arbitrage and quality trading.

## **What's the innovation? ⚡️**

### **The missing DeFi puzzle**

As one of the top 15 largest protocols by TVL volume, the TON ecosystem needs an important tool that will allow users to trade with leverage and open short positions. With the advent of the Storm protocol, the pieces of DeFi on TON will come together to form a complete, multi-faceted ecosystem.

Using fully decentralized, robust and contactless technologies such as virtual AMM and TWA (Telegram Web App), Storm allows users to create long or short positions in markets that are outside the TON ecosystem. Going beyond traditional cryptocurrencies, trading on Storm helps traders and investors radically diversify their portfolios, which is especially important during bear market periods.

### **Trading right in your Telegram**

Thanks to the emergence of TWA (Telegram Web App) technology, trading is able to reach a new level of user comfort. Imagine chatting with friends while opening long or short positions without leaving your Telegram. Can you imagine? It will be available when Storm arrives.

TWA lets you avoid lengthy verification of a mobile app from the App Store or Play Market, while becoming an affordable option within one of the most popular messengers.

Notifications directly in the Telegram messenger will help the user keep their positions under control, informing the trader of the trades taking place and the status of their balance. Among other things, it opens up possibilities for creating new notification services, trading bots or bots with user balance tracking for absolutely any developer.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0_J5gGeH6khcu6d1B1mJw.png?height=1080&width=1920)

### Simplified interface and Pro mode

The goal of Storm Trade is to create the most user-friendly interface of the application combined with the most technologically advanced for traders. If you are tired of overloaded with information exchanges, the simplified interface will be to your liking. If, on the contrary, you want to immerse yourself in charts and indicators research, the Pro Mode will be your best partner. Smooth and elegance, nothing superfluous. That's what we strive for.

## **Storm Trade Launch Roadmap 🚀**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/itnT6tLBEL_dT_weI00mj.png?height=1080&width=1920)

* **Storm Testnet v1 launch | late June - July**

  Opening and closing positions, first trading pairs, thorough testing of the new platform with further rewards for everyone who wants to join the testing.

* **Community building and recruitment | late June - July**

  Community-building, creation of community chats and social networks, holding the first community events.

* **Storm Testnet v2 | late July - August**

  Trading tournaments, Stop loss and Take profit appearance, thorough testing of the platform before the audit with further rewards for everyone who wishes to join the testing.

* **Whitepaper** **and documentation** **| late July - August**

  Writing the Whitepaper and the appearance of technical documentation along with user guides for diving into the world of Storm.

* **Smart contract auditing | late August - early September**

  Thorough research and vetting of all smart contracts before launching on the TON Mainnet.

* **Storm Mainnet launch | September**

  Multiple trading pairs, NFT artifacts, tournaments for traders and more.

* **Token Launch | September**

Thank you for reading the article up to this point. We hope you are as enthusiastic as we are. Join our social networks and become early birds of the Storm community! ⚡️

[Chat](https://t.me/storm_trade_chat) | [News](https://t.me/storm_trade_news) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/storm_trade_ton)

body:
A little over a year ago, I pushed 2 posts: [one](https://mirror.xyz/0x9dbe535a234D89338680341D19207DFed62F78F1/ZB2r-OVxZnn2l5Rv5zbUMhEAUpMJGAaB8jVoixPtlzM) reflected on my own experience with Milady, and [the other](https://mirror.xyz/0x9dbe535a234D89338680341D19207DFed62F78F1/eqRKer1Mo57bSGApzAgjWblzpoydv0nVjeHfJjsWWj0) was an attempt to deconstruct the environment we’re in & how exactly we got here, both were underpinned by my *Milady investment thesis.* It took me some time to digest my own writing, and now I understand I wanted to post them as 'trade theses', just like CT traders post a chart and a little caption...

For better or worse, both posts were really disguised and backloaded with some secret hints… and I didn't really want to be secretive! This time, my goal is to be absolutely explicit! It was never about killing apes, as Milady flipping BAYC is an uneventful inevitability on the grand scale of the thesis.

![having fun online^^](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mTDDKBAj7JMUaYS_XztFp.png?height=828&width=950)

Lizzy777 fell up so hard in ‘22 that she pulled me up too, but we wouldn’t even be here if it wasn’t for a few legendary posters who make CT feel like an online home.

## Freedom to desire & desire for Freedom

> *We Really Logged On And Became The Best Versions Of Ourselves*

It's a brutal and bitter inevitability that the [wage gap is becoming unsurmountable](https://goldenlight.mirror.xyz/LeUojosmx48SvEfspq1leuRTf7TJfYKJ_TtKpePczzU): any path to success is paved with risk. There is Freedom in the Wired - and your strength is in your ability to curate the aesthetics of your feed — connect and disconnect from the network: being both online and offline to your fullest.

We logged on and became who we are so we can be who we are when we log off. We first logged on and found our freedoms, and then… we became free to desire!

### (Economic) Desire

Posters found their freedoms online, but what now? Poster’s love is contagious — inviting everyone to Just Have Fun Online & Be Whoever They Want — but what about the bullposters?

With great power comes great responsibility, and we’ve all been bitten by that bullish spider, intoxicated with the idea that in the end, it’s all gonna be okay. But it will only be okay if we take that responsibility, and only if we take it seriously!

With freedom, responsibility comes too, with that responsibility we have to discern what is universally liberating & universally oppressive; and in crypto, it seems that there is always a clear either/or, with very few in-betweens. Speculating on the future is exactly what drives it, and a clear vision of the future makes it all more likely.

We’re free to desire the future we want, and we desire to be free! Desire overflows into material reality… but sometimes, there’s no halal instrument to speculate on, sometimes the future is not entirely clear, but at least we got each other and we’ll bid up shitcoins because fuck you — that’s why. :D

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/DGGKEappEM7XEOdftne9W.png?height=370&width=936)

## The prophecy

And there is a prophecy: "If nobody ever sells, we'll go up forever".

Just don't sell, and the next candle will be green... Maybe nobody trades yet, it is fine, the previous candle was green, and the next candle is green, and the candle after that will be green and together, we’ll go higher and higher, one last time & forever…

Isn't that just like Love?

Hippies love the idea of overcoming the duality of Love & fear — release yourself of your fears and Love will shine woo! — but isn't that exactly what green and red candles are? And in love, when someone starts selling, and the other sees it, the chart goes to shit fast… but sometimes u try to save it. XD?

Any aspiring trader first has to learn discipline, just like in any religious practice; as for NEETs, discipline protects them from being [lazy and cringe losers](https://goldenlight.mirror.xyz/qrXKqoUvzXEtcbM_hvezCxmJaJn4t6CjAh2kocDzxNA) swallowed by time. Then… formulate a thesis and execute according to it. *Milady investment thesis* is an uncompromising belief in love, and love for all things of God, in God and God.

It’s easy to be fearless when love is not all that is on your mind. I’m afraid because I love! & *in spite* of my fears, I love moar! & BTFD, because  — all internal opps must be destroyed: **Total Bear Annihilation** — what other remedy is there, other than to *love moar, and love harder?* All in, no stops. Infinitely bullish, delusionally bullish! Milady to 50 ETH.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jGQYKlAidwJs4afICt8nd.png?height=322&width=1244)

### Delusionally bullish

Thinking a thesis through, working through it, adapting it to new information... sometimes you just have to ask yourself: "am I crazy?" - and the answer will be "I don't know!". Sometimes, in love, you will simply not know, and you have to accept it! True completeness is not without the presence of incompleteness, love fills the gap, … you know the story!

But Love can’t be bought, and neither can the ability to curate the aesthetics of your Feed. The Feed — the Timeline — is objective and real & not just pixels on your screen, and if you need a reason why it should be real then you don't really get it yet.

In our love-painted chart, where we never sell, we never go down, never a red candle, we long x1000 on leverage, we're all in & we believe in Network Spirituality. For these kinds of lovers, the 4-year Bitcoin cycle is like a mating call! A festival that only goes harder and harder.

You might think it's all just words words words, but the Feed is Real, and the proof of its reality is in its power. If you don't see it, you don't get it yet anyway & Milady to 50 ETH.

## Notsofast

![https://twitter.com/notsofast](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/81DuAZeie3f4E6rqom_4C.png?height=500&width=1500)

**vira**: gm! I think there's a school of thought on the spectrum where BTC and ETH maximalism exist, in their own self-important sense about how important it is to stand against CBDCs and WEF. There's something about this school of thought that keeps veterans like yourself coming back for more, season after season, just to gamble a little! just to throw a lil game of shitcoin dice. Would you agree?

And a second part to this question: what is it so comfy about being delusionally bullish? What is it about knowing that your financial future rests in Mother Nature's ability to secure our freedom to transact, compute, etc., and betting on that? & staying on the cutting edge of that, always finding out what to bet on, and oftentimes not knowing why!

> So the bullish delusion, put another way, can simply be called a commitment to conviction. For me it's always boiled down to the idea that because all of this stuff is open source, participation in it is voluntary for each individual. If it's gonna be the new money that the whole world uses and ensures every human is GMI, then it's up to each of us to choose to participate on those terms and with those beliefs held as strongly as we want. The default state of human action is free choice within environmental limits, so as we create and progress, why not foster systems that reduce those limits. If you value your own agency and optionality, even if you neet up in front of a cozy screen every waking moment, the limitless free choice that you *could* try whatever you want, is what permissionless money/value enables at a fundamental point. Morality affects this in a cool way but I believe our natural tendency is to do good and right, and optionality can foster this in a way where those who make choices that lift each other up become visibly more fulfilled than those who don't.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5v12yHKJ_C1AwFVN0_eFR.png?height=262&width=924)

**vira**: what do you think about the idea markets and automated market-making capabilities in general? looks like we're gonna be betting on everything — people, the weather,  ideas, fashion, trends... and the blockchain infrastructure seems pretty convenient for an AI agent to operate. Whether the instrument is an ERC20 shitcoin as it is now, or something different in the future, I think we see the proof of concept today. It’s as if we’ll end up having markets for everything — it’s only a question of ***who’s*** gonna *make* those markets — what do you think?

> **NSF:** The AMM and incentivized liquidity is a genius primitive invention and I have this feeling that it plus AI accelerates us towards the singularity of money and value, whereby we end up delegating all the degen profit creation and seeking to infinite agents we control, participate when we want as much as we want for the sake of entertainment, and come in a roundabout way to abundance in our physical world since our digital world's pervasive vast economy is roughly leveling out our baseline towards lack of want.

### Bullposting (shitcoin bandwagoning)

*I'm revealing secrets because the only criteria to become a believer (in NetSpi) is to just believe: believe in Milady’s Love & Love for Love’s sake!*

*Once you start to believe in Love, you start to crave a little long exposure. You have to go in when jeets go out, but why? Because all the jeets already jeeted. And if they didn't already… they will jeet soon enough! So buy more! & you just have to believe…*

*A hungry jeet will bite the hands that feed it, And In This Economy, We All Crave Love. So, it's time everybody jeets out of the dogshit they don't actually believe in,* **and rally the fuck up and buy my shitcoin bags.**

Whichever way we put it, the world out there is full of jeets running the monkey money world, because when it comes to dumping your bags, we’re all the same: naked, exposed, and raw.

![White Tiger (2021)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1dUQ0s5eqCi2jnHZYeA6N.png?height=1744&width=3584)

## Generational wealth (transfer)

*The White Tiger is said to emerge from the jungle once in a generation, and the schizos on the Feed are saying Kali Yuga is ending prematurely in 2025. All White Tigers are out of the jungle now, and everyone is here, waiting... waiting for the 1000-year distributed Remilia Corporation retard season to start. The New Millennium.*

**vira:** Many of the crypto enthusiasts came from a youtube arc of how the Fed came to be in 1913, what preceded that, and then discovering a completely new enthusiasm for finance in scripture that is the *Bitcoin whitepaper.* The forecast is that the world is ready to level up, and it’s as if crypto is like Noah’s arc for the long-anticipated apocalypse. The bitter end of red candles suggests that those in power are likely to stay in power… but it seems that we all keep coming back for another game of dice in the hopes of catching something in that creatively destructive overflow. How does that resonate with you?

> **NSF:** XD up only :P

![up only!!!](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lbB8OmKVkV3msmqMY6lCz.png?height=164&width=938)

### Retard season

tbh, lots of words words words but rly i wanna say we are here for reasons unknown to us driven by forces we cannot understand and we are all compelled to bid it up cuz the world as we know it is falling apart & falling up and our desire for a better future is reflected in our retard bullishness ^\_^

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fc0LMeq6VfvSF9qBKwR3P.png?height=658&width=948)

and just like in love you really don’t need particulars and specifics, you don’t need to think too much — the thinking has already been done for u, u just need to send it :) truth is all u need to know & know your fate is in good hands, with lady luck :)

![signs of froth](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XQajj81alE2KSZ34qCn4X.png?height=580&width=936)

:DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD:D::D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D

body:
**Bybit投资孵化的Dex iZiSwap在zkSync上开启了pool party的活动。活动分8周，现在已上线4周，交易50/500USD，添加50/500USD的流动性若干天即可参与抽奖并且获得积分，前四周项目方拿出了150万个iZi用于激励用户交互，中奖名额不少，最小的奖励也能覆盖gas损耗，积分可以用于在将来兑换zkSync给iZiSwap的空投。在交互zkSync的同时也可以选择交互一下iZiSwap。**

<https://galxe.com/izumi/campaign/GCiLQU6RLe>

下面我们来说下具体活动怎么参与

<https://galxe.com/izumi/campaign/GCxPqU6VJZ>

根据Galxe上的任务要求，完成社交媒体的关注。

这里有一个Discord的邀请任务，进入discord服务器生成自己的专属邀请链接，生成邀请链接详细步骤到Discord中#invite-rules中查看，邀请1位好友进入可以获得iZUMi Elite的身份能在Galxe上领取2积分，邀请三位好友进入可以获得iZUMi  Expect的身份能在Galxe上领取8积分。已邀请人数可以到⁠⁠#check-invites频道输入/invites查看自己的邀请数量。如果你已经完成了邀请，耐心等待3天即可。

**1)进入[官网](https://zksync.izumi.finance):[ ](https://izumi.finance/)zksync.izumi.finance**

**首先，点击页面右上角的“Connect Wallet”，并且切换至“zkSync Era”网络。**

**注：可以通过<https://chainlist.org/>搜索zkSync添加zkSync Era 主网**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oaTAo4gqFCAYMQrSUTnZZ.png?height=609&width=1600)

**如果你还没资金跨链到zkSync Era上，可以进入官方跨链桥：<https://bridge.zksync.io/>**

**连接小狐狸钱包，选择你想要跨链的币种以及数量后点击“Deposit”即可。**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wkEreq6F-Ob0mZR4ykMEB.png?height=762&width=1600)

2)选择你想要交易的币种，“From”是你钱包里有的资产，“To”是你希望获得的资产，并且输入数量

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QqmS6ZSZLW7AbJFs0tE2y.png?height=766&width=1600)

这里我们输入0.25ETH（大约500U+）来完成“Platinum Trader”活动，也可以选择更多或者更少金额.

3)点击 “Swap”，即可完成任务. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HOr8FfqUHeoIG2Dg9d4gQ.png?height=769&width=1600)

接下来是添加流动性的任务。 

1) 选择左侧导航栏中的 "Liquidity" 后点击"Add Liquidity+"

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a81M5Ci2IveripeTCga80.png?height=762&width=1600)

2)选择你想要提供流动性的池子以及手续费档次，这里我们选择ETH-USDC的池子手续费为0.2%。

选择你想要提供流动性的价格区间以及数量，然后我们放入300USDC会自动显示所需的ETH（LP金额大于500 USD可以完成“Diamond LP”参与抽奖）。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/arXNea53EPl9iq71XDF7B.png?height=815&width=1600)

4)如果你是第一次添加流动性需要现“Approva USDC”后点击“Creat”。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eWlfE4P9iiku_4_LTaz9O.png?height=1064&width=1600)

该活动目前发布了4周，也就是说每周都可以来重复进行链上操作赚取积分和izi奖励，可以依照上述指南每周记得到iziswap上操作一次获取奖励，同时在zksync上的交互越多，未来潜在得到zk代币的数量也可能越多。

body:
Welcome to Cora, a decentralized money market protocol with a novel design, that allows borrowers to get loans without the risk of being liquidated. 

**Introduction**

The crypto lending market peaked at around $45 Billion in 2021. This is huge for an emerging novel sector. Although there’s great potential in on-chain money markets, flaws like abrupt liquidations, capital inefficiency, and risks associated with liquidity, cause market and interest rates to hold them back from achieving their true potential.

Focusing on these issues, we leverage our experience with top DeFi option protocols to build a new primitive, which makes crypto lending more efficient, optimised, and free from abrupt liquidations. \*sighs in relief\*

**What is Cora?**

Cora is a decentralized lending protocol that allows users to borrow stablecoins for a fixed period of time without the risk of being liquidated. Borrowers only pay a one time borrowing fee and they can use any supported token as collateral.

Liquidity providers can provide any supported stablecoin to the protocol and earn constant yield without any management.

 **Why Cora?**

Traditional lending protocols like AAVE and Compound put all the risk on the borrowing side. Borrowers are not only exposed to external market conditions and abrupt price decreases, but also to threats like liquidation thresholds that have the intention to incentivise actors like liquidators.

 This dynamic is a disadvantage for the borrower, it fully exposes them, which we believe is wrong. 

 Entering Cora.Money

 **How Cora Works**

Cora eliminates the full risk from borrowers and offers a clear picture of their position. They know in advance the amount they need to repay (including the borrowing fee), their downside, and their potential upside, which is unlimited.

“Lenders” or Liquidity Providers take the risk of the loan while retaining the management over said risk. The Cora protocol helps LPs avoid losses by defining risk parameters like LTV and selecting the right pricing model. These models are fully decentralized and are based on Option pricing theory.

Picture both parties’ positions as the following: 

![Borrower and LP positions](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MFh0nYpP8BGHzq3WUGB9H.png?height=496&width=1066)

**What makes Cora unique**

**Capital Efficiency**

Liquidity providers only deposit stablecoins in a lending pool.

The first version of the Cora protocol will support one pool of capital per collateral type. However, we are working on a multi-collateral design, which means that a single pool of liquidity will be able to offer loans and accept multiple collaterals.

We expect this to be a huge advantage, since it will maximize capital efficiency.

Our plans include the whole ETH family and its derivatives like stETH, cbETH, RETH, ERC-4626s using ETH and LP tokens, for instance stETH-ETH.

**Immutable**

Our smart contracts are non-upgradeable, which means the rules are written in code, and code is law.

**Permissionless**

Anybody will be able to create their own lending pools with any of their desired pricing models, initially this will be done through proposals to the Cora DAO which will group the community interests.

**Modular pricing models**

A lending pool can have any price model. This has immense implications, anybody can build endless products using the Cora protocol as base layer,such as interest rate swaps, structured products, and more.

**Decentralized pricing models**

Our decentralized price models allow anyone to participate in the management and maintenance of the price model. This will include mechanisms for dispute and resolution using UMA protocol but also incentives for actors that help to support the price model mechanism.

**Community owned**

The Cora protocol is a public good. The community will drive the development and vision of the Cora protocol.

The protocol design includes native economic mechanisms to incentivise actors to participate in the growth of the Cora protocol.

**Ways you can get involved**

If you are a financial engineer, risk manager or mere DeFi aficionado and want to build on top of Cora or contribute in any manner, join us now to help drive Cora to the infinity and beyond..

Follow Us:

 

Website: https://www.cora.money/

Discord: https://chat.cora.money/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/CoraProtocol

body:
***Vision Protocol Testnet phase 2 has arrived and it brings along an exhilarating summer extravaganza called Frens Summerfest. This incredible event guarantees an unforgettable summer for Web3 communities, while also introducing numerous users to Vision Protocol's innovative features and user interface. By doing so, it sets the stage for an enhanced experience in epic tournaments that will leave everyone in awe.***

## Testnet phase 2

Testnet phase 2 is the most recent upgrade of the Vision Protocol Testnet, encompassing significant enhancements, which include:

**New feature:** Get ready for an exciting new feature launch, including **Quick match, Winners, Live Tournaments, Global Chat, Ranking,…**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tJdUBRiObLAeyG9gYOTx5.png?height=1152&width=1920)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z_bUboRPZTECAQwyY_yR3.png?height=720&width=1200)

**New UI:** Brand-new, user-friendly UI has been redesigned to make it more intuitive and easier to use. 

<https://twitter.com/VisionProtocol/status/1676492167949488128?s=20>

## Frens Summerfest

Frens Summerfest, hosted by Vision Protocol and Dackie Swap, is the most exciting Web3 event of the summer. It is held in Testnet V2 from June 30th to July 20th, excluding the weekend. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ss9t--QqltFs3n_WZOd_n.png?height=1152&width=1920)

In addition, there are 9 additional fantastic partners for this event:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uDRZeuL8DGib3i-nD4y8M.png?height=1152&width=1920)

* [Arcomia](https://twitter.com/OfficialArcomia)

* [NFTFeed](https://twitter.com/NFTFeedOfficial)

* [DerpDEX](https://twitter.com/DerpDEXcom)

* [Single Finance](https://twitter.com/single_finance)

* [Coral Finance](https://twitter.com/Coral_Finance)

* [Vaissel](https://twitter.com/FocusOnVaissel)

* [Arena of Faith](https://twitter.com/moba_aof)

* [BaseNS](https://twitter.com/basensdomains)

* [Plant Master](https://twitter.com/PlantMaster_nft)

## Frens SummerFest Side-events: Project Tournament Day

The main highlight of the event is a **10-day** series of thrilling community tournaments, featuring a generous prize pool of **$3300**.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uZOZGgsMkCTg95MQcaPDB.png?height=1065&width=1640)

Every day, there will be tournaments dedicated to specific projects, each offering a prize pool of **$300**.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IW96eLpx7zok9kvDK44PN.png?height=1152&width=1920)

### Rules:

**1/ Only those who claim NFT on Galxe are eligible to join the event**

Every project featured in Frens Summerfest will offer a unique Partnership NFT on Galxe. These NFTs serve as your ticket to join the corresponding tournament for each project. 

To ensure widespread participation, you are eligible to claim up to 10 NFTs, granting you access to all project tournaments included in Frens Summerfest. 

The NFT claim period spans from **7 AM UTC** on **June 30th** to **July 20th**, allowing you ample time to secure your NFTs and prepare for the exciting competitions ahead.

**2/ Criteria to share $3,000 prize pool**

Play **at least 2 matches** for each Project Tournament Day.

For example, to be eligible for the $300 prize pool of Dackie Tournament Day, you need to have claimed a Dackie NFT on Galxe and played a minimum of 2 matches on that day. 

Similarly, if you'd like to be eligible for an additional $300 prize pool on Vaissel Tournament Day, you must have claimed a Vaissel NFT on Galxe and played at least 2 matches on that specific day. 

The winner list will be announced on July 21st. The $300 prize pool of each Project Tournament Day will be equally divided among **60** lucky users of that Project Tournament Day.

**3/ A bonus lucky gift $300**

If you own 10 NFTs, you will be eligible for an additional gift of $300, which will be randomly distributed to 10 wallets ($30 each). The results will be announced on July 21st.

## FrensFest - Discord Referral Program

This is the side-event of Frens Summerfest on Vision Protocol Discord.

Join our Discord now: <https://discord.gg/visionprotocol>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8BeyEPIEtZ7AdkzUvpKcG.png?height=1152&width=1920)

### Rules & Rewards

Invite a minimum of 5 people to Vision Protocol's Discord. For each round, 10 random lucky members who successfully invite five or more people will win $100 in prize pools.

### Timeline

Round 1 will kick off on **Monday, July 3rd**, and continue until **Tuesday, July 11th**.

Round 2 will follow from **Wednesday, July 12th**, to **Friday, July 21st**.

### Result

Vision Protocol will run a raffle for the eligible one and announce the results after five working days from the end of each round.

## Conclusion

Join Frens Summerfest today to immerse yourself in the latest updates on Vision Protocol's platform and indulge in thrilling moments this summer, with a plenty of attractive prizes awaiting you.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us via [Discord](https://discord.gg/visionprotocol).

For more information about Frens Summerfest -Testnet V2: [Here.](https://docs.vp.xyz/incentive-programs/testnet-launch/testnet-phase-2-june-30th-july-20th)

## 🎮 ABOUT US

Vision Protocol is a platform for fun and engaging prediction battle royales, where users of all levels can participate in thrilling gameplay on Arbitrum. The platform prioritizes fairness and transparency by making its calculation methods and price feeds publicly accessible. It also operates on a real-yield business model that uses USDC for financial stability and long-term benefits for all stakeholders.

Follow us: [Website](https://vp.xyz/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VisionProtocol) | [Discord](https://discord.gg/visionprotocol)
